title: 112_hr2470
content: The Act is titled the "Ensuring Servicemembers' Electronic Records' Viability Act" or the "E-SERV Act". It establishes a Department of Defense-Department of Veterans Affairs Interagency Program Office. The Wounded Warrior Act is amended to establish a single program office for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs to develop interoperable electronic health record systems. The Wounded Warrior Act is amended to establish a single program office for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs responsible for developing, implementing, and sustaining electronic health record systems. The Director of the office reports directly to the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs without any other supervising official, with joint delegation authority. The Secretaries may jointly delegate supervision to officials from the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs at a level not lower than Deputy Secretary. The function of the Office is to develop, implement, and sustain electronic health record systems for both Departments, ensuring interoperability and seamless integration of personal health care information. The Office is responsible for developing and maintaining electronic health record systems for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs, ensuring compliance with interoperability standards and representing the Departments to other government agencies and Congress. The Office is responsible for planning, budgeting, and executing activities related to electronic health record systems for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs, including design, development, testing, acquisition, implementation, and sustainment. This includes submitting budget materials to the President for approval. The Office is responsible for electronic health record systems for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs. Personnel assigned to the Office shall be under the direction of the Director, and resources requested by the Director shall be furnished by the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs. The Office oversees electronic health record systems for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs. Funds for the interagency program office established under the Wounded Warrior Act cannot exceed 10% until the Secretaries of Defense and Veterans Affairs certify that certain amendments have been implemented.
